greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways of partitioning the set of the first n primes into two subsets whose sums differ at most by 1.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[i==0, If[n <= 1, 1, 0], If[n > s[i], 0, Function[ p, b[n + p, i - 1] + b[Abs[n - p], i - 1]][Prime[i]]]];
a /@ Range[0, 45] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 30 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Bisections give: A022894 (odd part), A113040 (even part).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 31 2019
